lines.text: 'Grandma and Grandpa were on the Titanic.'
I'm sorry ma'am. Your dog will have to stay behind. And you too sir.
Nobody is going to tell me that my Charlie is going to have stay behind!
I'm sorry ma'am, your husband will have to stay behind.
I'm not talking about my husband! I'm talking about Charlie, I'm not going to leave my poor helpless dog on a sinking ship!
You can't let these women go alone.
You heard me. No men! No dogs!
Charlie will stay right here, thank you!

[to a crew member]
I'm not asking you to kiss me.
Sometimes being on a ship is like being in jail. With the possibility of drowning.
Not only did you stop your engines, you reversed them! She would have turned much more quickly the greater the forward motion!
never turn your broadside to danger. Had we struck the 'berg head on, only one compartment would have been flooded!
I thought I could avoid the 'berg altogether, sir.
Hello, miss.
What the...?
Your boyfriend's not around to protect you, right?
Don't try to blackmail me. I could tell them a few things meself.
I've worked for the White Star Line for 12 years. I'm a trusted employee. Who do you think they're going to believe? Me, or Mr. Dickie, who isn't Mr. Dickie at all?
[Captain Lord is asleep on the chart room table and the phone rings next to his head, startling him awake]
[annoyed]
What do you want?

There's a line... often quoted... in the newspapers. "God Himself Could Not Sink This Ship". She was appropriately named! The Titan's dared to challenge the God's. And for their arrogance, they were cast down into hell.
Out of the question. Lock the guns back in the safe. I can't have you shooting my passengers.
You'd rather they drown?
Lower away! Lower away!
If you'll get the hell out of the way, they'd be able to do something!
You're not going fast enough, quick up! Quick up!
If they go any faster they'll drown the whole lot of them!
Do you know who I am?
I don't care if you're the bloody Prince of Wales, you move back or I'll knock your teeth down your throat!
Don't point your finger at me, young man!
meeting all of those reporters.

[Talking to Jamie]
Let me give you a bit of advice. I always find investors for my projects. It's better to use another fellow's money.

[after observing that Jamie is shocked seeing her smoking a cigar]
What's the matter? Never seen a woman smoke a cigar before?
Well, no. I mean, not a lady, anyway. Not like you.
Well, get used to it. Woman's emancipation. We can smoke cigars. We can tell you men how to run the world. Hell, we'll probably have a woman president in the next hundred years.
"Low, low. Breathe and blow, wind from the western sea. Over the rolling waters go, come from the dying moon and blow."
Sir?
On my word, I have not thought of that verse since I was a cabin boy. Love of the ocean brought me to the sea as a lad and there's still wonder in it.
